news.Content: • 采鈺11月合併營收為7.84億元，年減8.42% [1]。過去一週股價下跌4.81%。, • 采鈺已完成限制員工權利新股收回註銷的實收資本額變更登記 [2]。 【綜合分析】 參考來源：Yahoo奇摩股市: 2則 | 資料期間：2025-11-26 至 2025-12-10 | 新聞數量：2 則 采鈺（6789）近期股價表現受到營收數據影響，根據最新公布的資訊，公司在2025年11月的合併營收為7.84億元，相較去年同期衰退8.42% [1]。在此消息公布的影響下，采鈺的股價近期呈現震盪走勢。從股價資訊來看，截至2025年12月18日的最新收盤價為257.00元，較前一日下跌1.53%。若拉長時間觀察，近一週的股價跌幅達4.81%，顯示市場情緒偏向謹慎。 除了營收數據的公布，采鈺也在11月下旬完成了一項重要的公司內部治理事項。公司於2025年11月26日公告，已完成限制員工權利新股收回註銷的實收資本額變更登記 [2]。此舉涉及公司資本額的調整，減資前的實收資本額為新台幣3,183,141,190元，流通在外股數為318,314,119股。註銷減資後，實收資本額調整為新台幣3,182,991,190元，流通在外股數相應減少。雖然這項變更登記屬於例行性的財務操作，但其對公司每股淨值及股東權益的影響，仍是市場關注的焦點之一。綜合來看，營收的下滑以及資本額的調整，是近期影響采鈺股價表現的兩大主要因素。

news.Title: [AI Summary] VisEra November Revenue Down 8.42% YoY, Stock Drops Nearly 5% This Week
news.Content: • VisEra's consolidated revenue for November was NT$784 million, a year-on-year decrease of 8.42% [1]. The stock price has fallen by 4.81% in the past week., • VisEra has completed the registration for changes in paid-in capital related to the cancellation of restricted employee stock options [2]. [Analysis] Sources: Yahoo Finance Taiwan: 2 articles | Period: 2025-11-26 to 2025-12-10 | Number of articles: 2 VisEra (6789) has recently seen its stock price influenced by its revenue figures. According to the latest disclosed information, the company's consolidated revenue for November 2025 reached NT$784 million, marking an 8.42% year-on-year decline [1]. In the wake of this announcement, VisEra's stock price has shown a volatile trend. The latest closing price on December 18, 2025, was NT$257.00, a 1.53% drop from the previous day. Observing a broader timeframe, the stock has fallen by 4.81% over the past week, indicating a cautious market sentiment. In addition to the revenue announcement, VisEra also completed a significant corporate governance matter in late November. On November 26, 2025, the company announced the completion of the registration for changes in paid-in capital, following the cancellation of restricted employee stock options [2]. This action involved an adjustment to the company's capital. Before the share cancellation and capital reduction, the paid-in capital was NT$3,183,141,190 with 318,314,119 outstanding shares. After the cancellation and reduction, the paid-in capital was adjusted to NT$3,182,991,190, with a corresponding decrease in outstanding shares. While this registration change is a routine financial operation, its impact on the company's net asset per share and shareholder equity remains a focal point for market attention. In summary, the decline in revenue and the adjustment in paid-in capital are the two primary factors influencing VisEra's stock performance recently.
